reasoning: The cooking steps were extracted based on the sequential actions described by Jacques Pepin for making hummus. Each step is a continuation of the process, starting from preparing the chickpeas to the final garnishing of the dish.
dish_description: The dish is a variation of classic hummus made with chickpeas, peanut butter instead of tahini, and garnished with feta cheese, chives, Spanish paprika, and pepper.

cooking_steps.description: Drain the can of chickpeas, reserving some of the water for later use.
Peel and add 3 to 4 cloves of garlic into the food processor.
Add the drained chickpeas to the food processor.
Pour 2 to 3 tablespoons of the reserved chickpea water into the food processor.
Add about a tablespoon of lemon juice to the mixture.
In lieu of tahini, add a couple of tablespoons of peanut butter to the food processor.
Season with hot sauce and salt to taste.
Pour in approximately a third of a cup of olive oil.
Process all the ingredients until smooth, then taste and adjust seasoning if necessary.
Spread the hummus onto a plate and crumble feta cheese on top.
Garnish with chives, Spanish paprika, and a drizzle of olive oil.
Finish with a sprinkle of pepper for color and additional flavor.
